units.name: The Global Tapestry
units.desc: A quiz on how states formed, expanded, and declined in areas of the world during the period c. 1200–c. 1450 and the related political, social, and cultural developments of that time.

units.name: Networks of Exchange
units.desc: A quiz on how areas of the world were linked through trade and how these connections affected people, cultures, and environments.

units.name: Land-Based Empires
units.desc: A quiz on the empires that held power over large contiguous areas of land in the time period c. 1450-c. 1750.

units.name: Transoceanic Interconnections
units.desc: A quiz about advances in ocean exploration, the development of new maritime empires, and the effects of new cross-cultural encounters during the time period c. 1450-c. 1750.

units.name: Revolutions
units.desc: A quiz about the period c. 1750–c. 1900, where new political ideas and developments in technology led to large-scale changes in governments, society, and economies.

units.name: Consequences of Industrialization
units.desc: A quiz about learning how different states acquired and expanded control over colonies and territories during the period c. 1750-c. 1900.

units.name: Global Conflict
units.desc: A quiz about the global conflicts that dominated the 1900's to the present.

units.name: Cold War and Decolonization
units.desc: A quiz about colonies’ pursuits of independence and the global power struggle between capitalism and communism during the period c. 1900-present.

units.name: Globalization
units.desc: A quiz about the causes and effects of the unprecedented connectivity of the modern world during the period c. 1900-present.
